title: New class wizard doesn't get context right for nested classes
description: When using the new class wizard, the context for nested classes is not set correctly, causing the default value to be blank instead of the current type in the editor.
OB: When using the new class wizard, the 'Enclosing Type' field is blank.
EB: When using the new class wizard, the 'Enclosing Type' field should default to the current type in the editor.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open a .java file in the editor.
2. Click on the new class button.
3. Check the 'Enclosing Type' field in the new class wizard.
